title: Vada Pav
description: A deep-fried potato dumpling placed inside a bread bun (pav) sliced almost in half through the middle.

title: Pav Bhaji
description: A fast food dish consisting of a thick vegetable curry served with a soft bread roll.

title: Chole Bhature
description: A combination of chana masala (spicy white chickpeas) and bhatura/puri, a deep-fried bread.

title: Parathas
description: A flatbread native to the Indian subcontinent, prevalent throughout the modern-day nations of India, Sri Lanka, Pakistan, Nepal, Bangladesh, Maldives and Myanmar, where wheat is the traditional staple.

title: Kathi Roll
description: A street-food dish originating from Kolkata, West Bengal, consisting of a skewer-roasted kebab wrapped in a paratha bread.

title: Puchka (Pani Puri)
description: A type of snack that originated in the Indian subcontinent, and is one of the most common street foods in India.
